00032 static const string usage =
00033   "apt-dump-pgf - Dump information from a pgf file.\n"
00034   "Usage:\n"
00035   "   apt-dump-pgf -o int.txt -c file.clf -p file.pgf [--probeset-type=type [--probeset-type=...]]\n\n"
00036   "   apt-dump-pgf -o int.txt -c file.clf -p file.pgf [--probeset-ids=file [--probeset-ids=...]]\n\n"
00037   "   apt-dump-pgf -o int.txt -c file.clf -p file.pgf [--probe-ids=file [--probe-ids=...]]";
00038

00040   {
00041     "p", "pgf-file", PgOptions::STRING_OPT,
00042     "The pgf file used to dump information.",
00043     "", NULL
00044   };

00050     "probe position will be included in the output.",
00051     "", NULL
00052   };

00065     "can be specified multiple times. When specified "
00066     "multiple times, the intersection of all types "
00067     "is taken. The user cannot mix use of probeset-type, "
00068     "probeset-ids, and probe-ids.",

00122   {
00123     &PGF_FILE_OPT,
00124     &CLF_FILE_OPT,
00125     &PROBESET_TYPE_OPT,
00126     &PROBESET_ID_FILE_OPT,

00147 dumpPgf::dumpPgf (int argc, char* argv[], const std::string& version, const std::string& cvsId)
00148   : m_Version (version), m_CvsId (cvsId), m_GetProbeCoordinates (0)
00149 {
00150   
00151   // Prefer throw() to exit().
00152   Err::setThrowStatus (true);
00153 
00154   PgOptions::hack_resetOptionsList(options);
00155   //
00156   m_Opts = new PgOptions (usage, options);
00157   m_Opts->parseOptions (argc, argv);
00158 
00159   // Optionally display usage message.
00160   if (m_Opts->boolOpt ("help") || argc == 1)
00161   {
00162     m_Opts->usage();
00163     string msg = "version:\n";
00164     msg += "   " + version + "\n";
00165     msg += "   " + cvsId;
00166     cout << msg;
00167     exit(0);
00168   }
00169   // Optionally display version.
00170   if (m_Opts->boolOpt ("version"))
00171   {
00172     string msg = "version: " + version + "   " + cvsId;
00173     cout << msg;
00174     exit(0);
00175   }
00176 
00177   // Require pgf file.
00178   m_PgfFileName = m_Opts->strOpt ("pgf-file");
00179   if (m_PgfFileName.empty())
00180   {
00181     string msg = "Must provide pgf file.";
00182     Err::errAbort (msg);
00183   }
00184   // Optional clf file.
00185   m_ClfFileName = m_Opts->strOpt ("clf-file");
00186 
00187   // Save optional types.
00188   for (PgOptions::PgOpt* typeOpt = m_Opts->findPgOpt ("probeset-type");
00189       typeOpt != 0; typeOpt = typeOpt->next)
00190     // Discard empty strings.
00191     if (strlen (typeOpt->getValue()) != 0)
00192       m_ProbesetTypes.push_back (typeOpt->getValue());
00193 
00194   // Save optional probeset, probe id file names.
00195   for (PgOptions::PgOpt* fileOpt = m_Opts->findPgOpt ("probeset-ids");
00196       fileOpt != 0; fileOpt = fileOpt->next)
00197     if (strlen (fileOpt->getValue()) != 0)
00198       m_ProbesetIdFileNames.push_back (fileOpt->getValue());
00199   for (PgOptions::PgOpt* fileOpt = m_Opts->findPgOpt ("probe-ids");
00200       fileOpt != 0; fileOpt = fileOpt->next)
00201     if (strlen (fileOpt->getValue()) != 0)
00202       m_ProbeIdFileNames.push_back (fileOpt->getValue());
00203 
00204   // Allow only one of probeset-type, probeset-ids, or probe-ids options.
00205   int optionsChosen = 0;
00206   optionsChosen += m_ProbesetTypes.empty() ? 0 : 1;
00207   optionsChosen += m_ProbesetIdFileNames.empty() ? 0 : 1;
00208   optionsChosen += m_ProbeIdFileNames.empty() ? 0 : 1;
00209 
00210   if (optionsChosen > 1)
00211   {
00212     string msg = "Cannot mix use of --probeset-ids, --probe-ids, ";
00213     msg += "and --probeset-type.";
00214     Err::errAbort (msg);
00215   }
00216 
00217   // Save optional probeset-only, or flags.
00218   m_DumpProbesetsOnly = m_Opts->boolOpt ("probeset-only");
00219   m_DumpUnion = m_Opts->boolOpt ("or");
00220 
00221   // Probeset-only is incompatible with a probe-ids list.
00222   if (m_DumpProbesetsOnly && !m_ProbeIdFileNames.empty())
00223     Err::errAbort ("Cannot use --probeset-only with --probe-ids.");
00224 
00225   // Output to cout unless a writeable file was selected.
00226   m_Outfile = m_Opts->strOpt ("out-file");
00227   if (m_Outfile.empty())
00228     Err::errAbort ("Must provide an output file, --out-file option.");
00229   else
00230   {
00231     Util::mustOpenToWrite (m_FileOut, m_Outfile);
00232     m_Out = &m_FileOut;
00233   }
00234 
00235   // The command line is copied to output.
00236   assert (argc > 0);
00237   m_CommandLine = argv[0];
00238   for (int i = 1; i < argc; ++i)
00239     m_CommandLine += " " + string (argv [i]);
00240 }
00241 
00247 void dumpPgf::run()
00248 {
00249   // Write initial output.
00250   beginOutput();
00251 
00252   // Read optional probeset or probe id files.
00253   readIdFiles();
00254 
00255   // Open input files.
00256   openInputFiles();
00257 
00258   // Write output header.
00259   writeOutputHeader();
00260 
00261   // Write lines matching selection criteria.
00262   writeMatches();
00263 }
00264 
00268 void dumpPgf::readIdFiles()
00269 {
00270   // Probeset id file(s).
00271   map <int, bool> probesetIdsMap;
00272   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < m_ProbesetIdFileNames.size(); ++i)
00273   {
00274     string& probesetIdFileName = m_ProbesetIdFileNames[i];
00275     TsvFile tsv;
00276     int probesetId;
00277     tsv.bind (0, "probeset_id", &probesetId, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00278     if (tsv.open (probesetIdFileName) != TSV_OK)
00279       Err::errAbort ("Problem opening probeset id file " + probesetIdFileName);
00280     while (tsv.nextLevel (0) == TSV_OK)
00281       // Ignore duplicate ids.
00282       if (probesetIdsMap.insert (make_pair (probesetId, true)) .second)
00283         m_ProbesetIds.push_back (probesetId);
00284     tsv.close();
00285   }
00286   Verbose::out(1,"Found " + ToStr(m_ProbesetIds.size()) + " probesets in probeset list files.");
00287   // Probe id file(s).
00288   map <int, bool> probeIdsMap;
00289   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < m_ProbeIdFileNames.size(); ++i)
00290   {
00291     string& probeIdFileName = m_ProbeIdFileNames[i];
00292     TsvFile tsv;
00293     int probeId;
00294     tsv.bind (0, "probe_id", &probeId, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00295     if (tsv.open (probeIdFileName) != TSV_OK)
00296       Err::errAbort ("Problem opening probe id file " + probeIdFileName);
00297     while (tsv.nextLevel (0) == TSV_OK)
00298       // Ignore duplicate ids.
00299       if (probeIdsMap.insert (make_pair (probeId, true)) .second)
00300         m_ProbeIds.push_back (probeId);
00301     tsv.close();
00302   }
00303   Verbose::out(1,"Found " + ToStr(m_ProbeIds.size()) + " probes in probe list files.");
00304 }
00305 
00309 void dumpPgf::beginOutput()
00310 {
00311     Verbose::out(1,"MODULE: " + m_Version + " " + m_CvsId);
00312     Verbose::out(1,"CMD: " + m_CommandLine);
00313     m_ExecGuid = affxutil::Guid::GenerateNewGuid();
00314     Verbose::out(1,"exec_guid " + m_ExecGuid);
00315 }
00316 
00323 void dumpPgf::openInputFiles()
00324 {
00325     Verbose::out(1,"Reading meta data from PGF and CLF files");
00326   // Open pgf file.
00327   m_PgfTsv.bind (0, "probeset_id", &m_PgfProbesetId, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00328   if (! m_DumpProbesetsOnly)
00329     m_PgfTsv.bind (2, "probe_id", &m_PgfProbeId, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00330   if (m_PgfTsv.open (m_PgfFileName) != TSV_OK)
00331     Err::errAbort ("Problem opening file " + m_PgfFileName + ".");
00332 
00333   // If a clf file name was provided, open it.
00334   if (! m_ClfFileName.empty())
00335   {
00336     if (m_ClfTsv.open (m_ClfFileName) != TSV_OK)
00337       Err::errAbort ("Problem opening file " + m_ClfFileName + ".");
00338     if (m_SequentialClf.isSequential (m_ClfTsv))
00339       // If sequential, calculate coordinates by simple arithmetic.
00340       m_GetProbeCoordinates = &dumpPgf::getCoordsBySequentialClf;
00341     else
00342     {
00343       // Not sequential, use index to find coordinates.
00344       // Require probe_id, x, y columns.
00345       m_ClfTsv.bind (0, "probe_id", &m_ClfProbeId, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00346       m_ClfTsv.bind (0, "x", &m_ClfX, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00347       m_ClfTsv.bind (0, "y", &m_ClfY, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00348       // Will be indexing over probe_id.
00349       m_ClfTsv.defineIndex (0, "probe_id", TSV_INDEX_INT, 0);
00350       m_GetProbeCoordinates = &dumpPgf::getCoordsByIndex;
00351     }
00352   }
00353 
00354   // If probeset-ids file(s) were provided, index over probeset_id.
00355   if (! m_ProbesetIdFileNames.empty())
00356     m_PgfTsv.defineIndex (0, "probeset_id", TSV_INDEX_INT, 0);
00357   // Likewise for probe ids - already required that the user did not request both.
00358   if (! m_ProbeIdFileNames.empty())
00359     m_PgfTsv.defineIndex (2, "probe_id", TSV_INDEX_INT, 0);
00360 
00361   // Set up output header, bind pgf file data.
00362   m_ProbesetDataCount = m_PgfTsv.getColumnCount(0);
00363   // Save probeset level data other than the probeset_id (int)
00364   // as strings.
00365   m_ProbesetData.resize (m_ProbesetDataCount - 1);
00366   unsigned int k = 0;
00367   bool foundType = false;
00368   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < m_ProbesetDataCount; ++i)
00369   {
00370     string colName;
00371     m_PgfTsv.cidx2cname (0, i, colName);
00372     m_OutputColNames.push_back (colName);
00373     // Probeset_id is an int, type and probeset_name are strings.
00374     // To make generating output simpler, require that the
00375     // first column is the probeset_id.
00376     assert (! ((i == 0) && (colName != "probeset_id")) );
00377     if (colName != "probeset_id")
00378     {
00379       if (colName == "type")
00380       {
00381         m_ProbesetTypeCol = k;
00382         foundType = true;
00383       }
00384       m_PgfTsv.bind (0, i, &m_ProbesetData[k++]);
00385     }
00386   }
00387   // Subtract probeset_id column from data count.
00388   --m_ProbesetDataCount;
00389   // Require type column if user requested -probeset-type.
00390   if (! m_ProbesetTypes.empty() && ! foundType)
00391     Err::errAbort ("No type column in pgf file");
00392   // Bind atom, probe level data unless -probeset-only selected.
00393   if (m_DumpProbesetsOnly)
00394     m_AtomDataCount = m_ProbeDataCount = 0;
00395   else
00396   {
00397     m_AtomDataCount = m_PgfTsv.getColumnCount(1);
00398     m_ProbeDataCount = m_PgfTsv.getColumnCount(2);
00399     // Save atom and probe level data other than the probe_id (int)
00400     // as strings.
00401     m_AtomProbeData.resize (m_AtomDataCount + m_ProbeDataCount - 1);
00402     k = 0;
00403     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < m_AtomDataCount; ++i)
00404     {
00405       string colName;
00406       m_PgfTsv.cidx2cname (1, i, colName);
00407       m_OutputColNames.push_back (colName);
00408       m_PgfTsv.bind (1, i, &m_AtomProbeData[k++]);
00409     }
00410     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < m_ProbeDataCount; ++i)
00411     {
00412       string colName;
00413       m_PgfTsv.cidx2cname (2, i, colName);
00414       m_OutputColNames.push_back (colName);
00415       // Again, to make generating output simpler, require that
00416       // the first probe level column is the probe_id.
00417       assert (! ((i == 0) && (colName != "probe_id")) );
00418       // Already bound probe_id.
00419       if (colName != "probe_id")
00420         m_PgfTsv.bind (2, i, &m_AtomProbeData[k++]);
00421     }
00422     // Subtract probe_id column from data count.
00423     --m_ProbeDataCount;
00424     // If using a clf file, will write x and y columns.
00425     if (! m_ClfFileName.empty())
00426     {
00427       m_OutputColNames.push_back ("x");
00428       m_OutputColNames.push_back ("y");
00429     }
00430   } // end if (m_DumpProbesetsOnly)
00431 }
00432 
00436 void dumpPgf::writeOutputHeader()
00437 {
00438   // Generic apt meta tags.
00439   const string guid = affxutil::Guid::GenerateNewGuid();
00440   *m_Out << "#%guid=" << guid << "\n";
00441   *m_Out << "#%exec_guid=" << m_ExecGuid << "\n";
00442   *m_Out << "#%exec_version=" << m_Version << " " << m_CvsId << "\n";
00443   *m_Out << "#%create_date=" << Util::getTimeStamp() << "\n";
00444   *m_Out << "#%cmd=" << m_CommandLine << "\n";
00445 
00446   // Copy genome position file header meta tags to output.
00447   string key, value;
00448   m_PgfTsv.headersBegin();
00449   while (m_PgfTsv.headersNext (key, value) == TSV_OK)
00450     // Propagate only chip_type, lib_set_version, and lib_set_name.
00451     if ( (key == "chip_type") || (key == "lib_set_version") ||
00452         (key == "lib_set_name") )
00453       *m_Out << "#%" << key << "=" << value << "\n";
00454 
00455   // Write header line.
00456   unsigned int colNameCount = m_OutputColNames.size();
00457   assert (colNameCount > 0);
00458   *m_Out << m_OutputColNames[0];
00459   for (unsigned int i = 1; i < colNameCount; ++i)
00460     *m_Out << "\t" << m_OutputColNames[i];
00461   *m_Out << "\n";
00462 }
00463 
00467 void dumpPgf::writeMatches()
00468 {
00469   // If using a clf file, need a method for obtaining probe coordinates.
00470   if (! m_ClfFileName.empty())
00471     assert (m_GetProbeCoordinates);
00472 
00473   // Indexing probesets.
00474   if (! m_ProbesetIdFileNames.empty())
00475   {
00476     const unsigned int probesetIdCount = m_ProbesetIds.size();
00477     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < probesetIdCount; ++i)
00478     {
00479       if(i==0)
00480           Verbose::out(1,"Indexing probesets in PGF file");
00481       const int probesetId = m_ProbesetIds[i];
00482       if (m_PgfTsv.findBegin (0, "probeset_id", TSV_OP_EQ, probesetId) != TSV_OK)
00483         Err::errAbort ("Problem reading pgf file " + m_PgfFileName);
00484       const int resultCount = m_PgfTsv.findResultsCount();
00485       // Skip if no match.
00486       if (resultCount == 0)
00487         continue;
00488 
00489       // Fatal error if more than one match was found.
00490       else if (resultCount > 1)
00491       {
00492         string msg = "probeset_id '" + ToStr (probesetId);
00493         msg += "' is not a unique index. Duplicate probeset_id found, [";
00494         msg += ToStr (probesetId) + "] for pgf file " + m_PgfFileName;
00495         Err::errAbort (msg);
00496       }
00497       // Found one match - read, write data.
00498       if (m_PgfTsv.findNext() != TSV_OK)
00499         Err::errAbort ("Problem reading pgf file " + m_PgfFileName);
00500       if(i==0)
00501         Verbose::out(1,"Dumping probeset info");
00502       dumpProbesetData();
00503     }
00504   }
00505 
00506   // Indexing probes.
00507   else if (! m_ProbeIdFileNames.empty())
00508   {
00509     const unsigned int probeIdCount = m_ProbeIds.size();
00510     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < probeIdCount; ++i)
00511     {
00512       const int probeId = m_ProbeIds[i];
00513       if(i==0)
00514         Verbose::out(1,"Indexing probes in PGF file");
00515       if (m_PgfTsv.findBegin (2, "probe_id", TSV_OP_EQ, probeId) != TSV_OK)
00516         Err::errAbort ("Problem reading pgf file " + m_PgfFileName);
00517       const int resultCount = m_PgfTsv.findResultsCount();
00518       // Skip if no match.
00519       if (resultCount == 0)
00520         continue;
00521 
00522       // Fatal error if more than one match was found.
00523       else if (resultCount > 1)
00524       {
00525         string msg = "probe_id '" + ToStr (probeId);
00526         msg += "' is not a unique index. Duplicate probe_id found, [";
00527         msg += ToStr (probeId) + "] for pgf file " + m_PgfFileName;
00528         Err::errAbort (msg);
00529       }
00530       // Found one match - read, write data.
00531       if (m_PgfTsv.findNext() != TSV_OK)
00532         Err::errAbort ("Problem reading pgf file " + m_PgfFileName);
00533       if(i==0)
00534         Verbose::out(1,"Dumping probe info");
00535       dumpProbeData();
00536     }
00537   }
00538 
00539   // Dumping by probeset type.
00540   else if (! m_ProbesetTypes.empty())
00541   {
00542     Verbose::out(1,"Scanning PGF file probe for requested type(s)");
00543     const vector<string>::const_iterator userTypesBegin = m_ProbesetTypes.begin();
00544     const vector<string>::const_iterator userTypesEnd = m_ProbesetTypes.end();
00545     const unsigned int userTypesCount = m_ProbesetTypes.size();
00546     // Types in line read from pgf file.
00547     vector<string> pgfFileTypes;
00548     // User entered -or.
00549     if (m_DumpUnion)
00550       while (m_PgfTsv.nextLevel (0) == TSV_OK)
00551       {
00552         // Split type by '->'.
00553         splitTypes (m_ProbesetData[m_ProbesetTypeCol], pgfFileTypes);
00554         // Dump this probeset_id if pgf file type matches any of those specified by the user.
00555         const unsigned int pgfFileTypesCount = pgfFileTypes.size();
00556         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < pgfFileTypesCount; ++i)
00557           if (find (userTypesBegin, userTypesEnd, pgfFileTypes[i]) != userTypesEnd)
00558           {
00559             dumpProbesetData();
00560             break;
00561           }
00562       } // end while (m_PgfTsv.nextLevel (0) == TSV_OK)
00563     // Default 'and' - require pgf file types to include all of those specified by the user.
00564     else
00565       while (m_PgfTsv.nextLevel (0) == TSV_OK)
00566       {
00567         splitTypes (m_ProbesetData[m_ProbesetTypeCol], pgfFileTypes);
00568         const vector<string>::const_iterator pgfFileTypesBegin = pgfFileTypes.begin();
00569         const vector<string>::const_iterator pgfFileTypesEnd = pgfFileTypes.end();
00570         bool noMismatchFound = true;
00571         // Dump this probeset_id if type matches all of those specified by the user.
00572         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < userTypesCount; ++i)
00573         {
00574           if (find (pgfFileTypesBegin, pgfFileTypesEnd, m_ProbesetTypes[i]) == pgfFileTypesEnd)
00575           {
00576             // If one of the user requested types is not present in this pgf file line,
00577             // don't write the line.
00578             noMismatchFound = false;
00579             break;
00580           }
00581         }
00582         if (noMismatchFound)
00583           dumpProbesetData();
00584       } // end while (m_PgfTsv.nextLevel (0) == TSV_OK)
00585   }
00586 
00587   // None of the above - dump the entire pgf file.
00588   else
00589   {
00590     Verbose::out(1,"Dumping entire PGF file");
00591     while (m_PgfTsv.nextLevel (0) == TSV_OK)
00592       dumpProbesetData();
00593   }
00594 }
00595 
00599 void dumpPgf::splitTypes (const std::string& inputString, std::vector<std::string>& inputTypes)
00600 {
00601   // Want to reuse the output vector; clear it first.
00602   inputTypes.clear();
00603   size_t substrBegin = 0;
00604   for (;;)
00605   {
00606     size_t substrEnd = inputString.find ("->", substrBegin);
00607     if (substrEnd == string::npos)
00608     {
00609       // No more '->' - save what's left, quit.
00610       string subString = inputString.substr (substrBegin);
00611       // Avoid returning a null string from a terminating '->' or an empty inputString.
00612       if (! subString.empty())
00613         inputTypes.push_back (subString);
00614       break;
00615     }
00616     // Avoid null strings from an initial '->' or '->->'.
00617     if (substrEnd != substrBegin)
00618       inputTypes.push_back (inputString.substr (substrBegin, substrEnd - substrBegin) );
00619     // Continue following the '->'
00620     substrBegin = substrEnd + 2;
00621   }
00622 }
00623 
00627 void dumpPgf::dumpProbesetData()
00628 {
00629   // If dumping probesets only, write out data.
00630   if (m_DumpProbesetsOnly)
00631   {
00632     *m_Out << m_PgfProbesetId;
00633     for (unsigned int j = 0; j < m_ProbesetDataCount; ++j)
00634       *m_Out << "\t" << m_ProbesetData[j];
00635     *m_Out << "\n";
00636     return;
00637   }
00638   // Read, dump atom, probe level data.
00639   while (m_PgfTsv.nextLevel (1) == TSV_OK)
00640     while (m_PgfTsv.nextLevel (2) == TSV_OK)
00641       dumpProbeData();
00642 }
00643 
00647 void dumpPgf::dumpProbeData()
00648 {
00649   *m_Out << m_PgfProbesetId;
00650   for (unsigned int j = 0; j < m_ProbesetDataCount; ++j)
00651     *m_Out << "\t" << m_ProbesetData[j];
00652   // Keeping atom, probe level data, excluding probe_id, in
00653   // the m_AtomProbeData vector.
00654   unsigned int k = 0;
00655   for (unsigned int j = 0; j < m_AtomDataCount; ++j)
00656     *m_Out << "\t" << m_AtomProbeData[k++];
00657   // Previously required that the probe_id column be
00658   // first in the probe level data.
00659   *m_Out << "\t" << m_PgfProbeId;
00660   for (unsigned int j = 0; j < m_ProbeDataCount; ++j)
00661     *m_Out << "\t" << m_AtomProbeData[k++];
00662   // Dump x, y columns if a clf file is in use.
00663   if (! m_ClfFileName.empty())
00664   {
00665     (this->*m_GetProbeCoordinates) (m_PgfProbeId);
00666     *m_Out << "\t";
00667     // Write null coordinates if not defined.
00668     if (m_ClfX >= 0)
00669       *m_Out << m_ClfX;
00670     *m_Out << "\t";
00671     if (m_ClfY >= 0)
00672       *m_Out << m_ClfY;
00673   }
00674   *m_Out << "\n";
00675 }
00676 
00680 void dumpPgf::getCoordsBySequentialClf (const int probeId)
00681 {
00682   m_SequentialClf.getProbeCoordinates (probeId, m_ClfX, m_ClfY);
00683 }
00684 
00688 void dumpPgf::getCoordsByIndex (const int probeId)
00689 {
00690   if (m_ClfTsv.findBegin (0, "probe_id", TSV_OP_EQ, m_PgfProbeId) != TSV_OK)
00691     Err::errAbort ("Problem reading clf file " + m_ClfFileName);
00692   const int resultCount = m_ClfTsv.findResultsCount();
00693   // Fatal error if more than one match was found.
00694   if (resultCount > 1)
00695   {
00696     string msg = "probe_id '" + ToStr (m_PgfProbeId);
00697     msg += "' is not a unique index. Duplicate probe_id found, [";
00698     msg += ToStr (m_PgfProbeId) + "] for clf file " + m_ClfFileName;
00699     Err::errAbort (msg);
00700   }
00701   else if (resultCount == 1)
00702   {
00703     // Found one match - read x, y.
00704     if (m_ClfTsv.findNext() != TSV_OK)
00705       Err::errAbort ("Problem reading clf file " + m_ClfFileName);
00706   }
00707   // Write null x, y coordinates if no match found.
00708   else
00709     m_ClfX = m_ClfY = -1;
00710 }
